headline: Review Faults Elite Forces’ Combat Culture
abstract: An examination of the culture in the Army’s Green Berets, the Navy SEALs and other special operations troops found shortcomings but no “systemic ethics problem,” after a series of misconduct  allegations.
lead_paragraph: America’s special operations forces, like the Army’s Green Berets and the Navy SEALs, have developed a problematic culture that overemphasizes combat “to the detriment of leadership, discipline and accountability,” according to a sweeping review conducted by the military’s Special Operations Command.
keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces
United States Army Special Forces (Green Berets)
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
